abstract: PetroChina, China’s biggest oil and gas conglomerate, said Monday it had raised 66.8 billion yuan ($8.93 billion) from its initial public offering in Shanghai, making it the country’s largest domestic initial public offering so far.
lead_paragraph: PetroChina, China’s biggest oil and gas conglomerate, said Monday it had raised 66.8 billion yuan ($8.93 billion) from its initial public offering in Shanghai, making it the country’s largest domestic initial public offering so far.

headline.main: PetroChina Raises $8.9 Billion in Stock Offering
